ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's presentation with Stage 5 chronic kidney disease and gout closely matches the phenotypic features of the similar reference cases, all of which were diagnosed with this condition.
This condition is also known to present with chronic kidney disease and gout, and is a subtype of autosomal dominant tubulointerstitial kidney disease.
This disease can present with chronic kidney disease and hyperuricemia leading to gout, though it is less directly matched to the reference cases provided.
This is another form of autosomal dominant tubulointerstitial kidney disease that can present with chronic kidney disease and gout, though it is less commonly reported.
